  • Constructor Details

    • Position

      public Position(int row, int column) throws PositionException
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      row - Row where the position is.
      column - Column where the position is.
      Throws:
      PositionException - When the row and/or column are a negative value.

  • Method Details

      Setter of the attribute row.

      Throws:
      PositionException - When the new value of row is a negative value.

    • offsetBy

      public Position offsetBy(int dRow, int dColumn)
      Creates a new instance of Position with the position offset by the given amount.
      Parameters:
      dRow - Number of rows to offset by.
      dColumn - Number of columns to offset by.
      Returns:
      A new instance of Position with the given offset applied. Or null if any component of the resulting position is negative.

    • offsetBy

      public Position offsetBy(int dRow, int dColumn, int size)
      Creates a new instance of Position with the position offset by the given amount. If the resulting position is out-of-bounds (either because either position is negative or exceeds size), returns null.
      Parameters:
      dRow - Number of rows to offset by.
      dColumn - Number of columns to offset by.
      size - Number of rows and columns of the game board.
      Returns:
      A new instance of Position with the given offset applied or null if size is zero or negative, or the new position is negative or equal or greater than size.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - Object that we want to compare to the current object.
      Returns:
      true if the row and column are identicals. It returns false if:
      • o is not a Position object.
      • the row of both objects are not identical.
      • the column of both objects are not identical.
